sentences: Ma ei saa seda taluda, see on nii mind ületav! (I can't stand it, it's so overwhelming!),
Ta oli väga mind täis mures. (He was very worried about me.),
See mõte on mul mind kogu aeg kummitamas. (This thought haunts me all the time.)
context: The Estonian word 'mind' can have several meanings depending on context, similar to its English counterpart. It can refer to one’s thoughts or mental state ('in mind'), but also to a feeling of being affected by something, or even simply ‘me’. It is often used to express emotional states.
